result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Per SRN. Fax: SCSO, Dispatch, Jail.  gll

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Planet Fitness, Shanna E, and Samantha T.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

- Defendant to reside at Mothers house. 

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

1:13 PM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris,  Defendant Margrette June Balsley in court in custody.  Attorney Brian Smestad with intern Alison Casey in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Jeremiah James Harrelson in court for Margrette June Balsley. Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  DE does qualify for PD. DE updates address. QUASH warrant. Waive speedy PH.
